tags: and its pretty clearly what the starks are being set up to do across westeros
jon in the north with the wildlings
and the northerners with robbs will
sansa is going to gain influence in the vale
when they all join forces eventually it'll make them strong enough to fight the walkers
summary: nobody is gonna convince me nymeria uniting all the wolves in the riverlands into one single pack under her command isn’t...
body: nobody is gonna convince me nymeria uniting all the wolves in the riverlands into one single pack under her command isn’t foreshadowing for arya doing the same with the men tbh - the brotherhood, the houses loyal to the starks/tullys and the smallfolk alike. this entire region is a chaotic mess with a destructive zombie in the center of it all but they need to join forces and become organized before the white walkers tear down the wall. arya is the one who’s gonna do it. she has so much history here. shes fought and bled and cried. we’ve already seen her deliver mercy and justice to soldiers all over the riverlands. she saved an innocent baby and protected her friends. she’s been a hostage at the hands of monsters but she’s going to rise to power and save this entire region when she gives her mother mercy. then she’s going to become the new stark leader just like her brother. she’ll even have his crown. but more importantly she’ll have her fathers words: the lone wolf dies but the pack survives. this is what arya’s meant to do.

blog.name: tluohsalohcin
blog.title: Justice for Jon Snow and Jaime Lannister
blog.description: Official member of the Sansa Stark Defense Squad. Certified Jonsa Trash. Also a Nick Hoult loyalist since 2011.

summary:
My opinions when I watched S1 for the first time VS My opinions when I watched S1 recently for the second time
Jon Snow...
body:
My opinions when I watched S1 for the first time VS My opinions when I watched S1 recently for the second time

Jon Snow *perverted face* / Damn, he’s still a boy, bit naive, but with courage.

Joffrey can go fuck himself / Actually Cersei and even Robert spoiled him since very early years with the thought he can do whatever he wants when he becomes king, and ignored the early signs.

Robb is badass / Damn Robb boy, you swallowed your fear, you were doing just right and trying your best, ily.

Jaime is an asshole / We got from Jaime very early signs of a good heart, but we dismissed it.

Poor thing Daenerys / No matter what difficult life she got, she still manages to do her will no matter what and even if it is questionable. Also what kind of Stockholm Syndrome was that? Also puts a lot of value of she as kind of a sexual object. How did I dismissed it?

Tyrion is cynical / Still a cynical but spoiled man dragging about his fathers money in almost every situation.

Cersei is power hungry / Still a power hungry, but with some sense, she wasn’t conviced that killing Ned was the best thing, but still didn’t mind after all.

Poor babe Sansa / And still did nothing wrong, just tried to save her father and Joffrey betrayed her.

You good out there with weapons, Arya / I like her, but now I find her overrated.

blog.name: the-bisexual-disaster
blog.title: Proud Member of the Arya Stark Defence Club
blog.description: Kat, 17, she/they. Respect Carol Danvers and Arya Stark or die by my battleaxe

tags: i dont have a physical copy of acok so i couldnt cite it
also im kinda on vacation and i only have agot and a wrinkle in time with me
im not trying to attack anyone
im just trying to make sense of where this ship is coming from
yes i ship dany and arya but its more of a crackship
from what ive seen jaqarya shippers believe that its endgame
even though there isnt even a hint of romantic interest between them
if you do crackship ignore this post
body:
Block me if you must

but I don’t understand the jaqarya fandom?

Like I know he was in the show more than the books, but he was only “jaqen h’ghar for s2, and then after that, he took up the role of the kindly man. He wasn’t even in the books after ACoK. We know that jaqen is just a face, so the person who looks like him in s5/6 is most definitely someone else wearing his face.

Also, just plain no? In the books, Arya saw him as a way to feel strong. In harrenhall, she was being beaten nearly daily, and she was afraid of being exposed, not to mention the ordeal with the mountains men. Jaqen offered her three names and it made her feel like a wolf instead of a mouse. Once he shed the face of jaqen, he wasn’t in any other scene.

In the show, he had her blinded, beaten, and he ordered the waif to kill her. In episode 8 of season 6, we see that Arya is about ready to drive needle through his heart. She holds no love for him, and I believe that if she ever saw someone wearing that face again, her first instinct would be to kill that person.

All in all, I just don’t understand this fandom or why it’s being shipped. It’s rather toxic in both the books and the show. I know I really should just ship and let ship, but this has been bothering me for a while, and I can’t leave it alone.

(Please read the tags)

blog.name: alcoholicrattlesnake
blog.title: (Luciferys)
blog.description:
Eat the fruit
                         And kiss the snake goodnight

summary: Don’t repost my art. This is a WIP. I hope they don’t screw up this very important reunion next season. There must be some hair...
caption:
Don’t repost my art.

This is a WIP.

I hope they don’t screw up this very important reunion next season. There must be some hair mussing. And tears. I don’t want sassy Arya or cold ass Jon. I don’t want lame drama between them like they did with the Stark sisters last season.



‘She would have given anything if Jon had been here to call her “little sister” and muss her hair.’( A Game of Thrones - Arya V)

‘He remembered suddenly how he used to muss Arya’s hair. His little stick of a sister. He wondered how she was faring. It made him a little sad to think that he might never muss her hair again.‘( A Clash of Kings - Jon II)

……………………………………………………..

blog.name: ladyspartacus
blog.title: Untitled
blog.description: I have many fandoms and many ships and have an ongoing love affair with villains and darker MCs

body:
Lady Stoneheart and Arya Theory???

So I know a lot of people seem to think that Arya will end up in the Riverlands again so she can claim her pack (Nymeria & her little grey cousins) and so she can kill Lady Stoneheart, but I disagree. I don’t think Arya will end Lady Stoneheart, at least not in the Riverlands and not just after returning to Westeros. In fact, I don’t think she will run into the BWB while in the Riverlands. I think Arya will reclaim her relationship with Nymeria and possibly see some other old faces, but not the ones you would expect.

As for Lady Stoneheart, she will most likely make her way up North. Either because of the rumors about Arya, Stannis being up there in Winterfell & being a kin slayer(Undead!Cat is killing peeps she considers ‘no bueno’), Jon having gotten some sort of position of power in Winterfell (Catelyn wouldn’t be happy about that), cause she heard of Sansa being alive, or cause Thoros will convince her to head that way similar to the show (unlikely but a possibility). The Arya, Stannis, and Jon reasons are the most likely, in my opinion. I think she’ll already be headed North by the time Sansa heads there too. Plus, I don’t trust anything the show has to say so the Thoros one is less likely to me.

And while she’s up North, I think she’s going to have a very important role to play, which is the main reason I don’t think she will die in the Riverlands. What I mean pertains to the way she was brought back to life, the very literal 'Kiss of Life’. As far as we know being brought back isn’t something that widespread amongst the followers of the faith of the Lord of Light. If it was, more people would be converted and using it to try and bring their dead back. Furthermore, if Stoneheart was just meant to be a foil for the Frey’s & Brienne/ a stepping stone for Arya, then why give her such a unique way of being brought back? I’ll tell you why! It’s cause George is planning on using it later on. George has even stated that he thinks one of the double douches’ biggest mistakes is not bringing in Stoneheart (ie~ she’s vital to the story). Why say that if she’s just going to be killed by Arya??? No, she’s going to use the kiss to bring back someone else, who may or may not use it on someone else in return [possibly jon being brought back for a second time or the first( I only think this one because of how long cat had been dead when she was brought back vs beric & jon is at the wall where he won’t decompose any time soon) and then jon using this to bring back another maybe🤔(I have thoughts about this but I won’t get into that right now)]. Either way, George isn’t the type to introduce such a big game changer and then not use it.

Then there’s the whole Brienne plotline, which is currently tied to Stoneheart and the BWB the last time we read anything about them. Brienne is likely going to pass on some kind of info relevant to Stoneheart &/or be given a second chance with a new mission of sorts. I even think there’s a possibility of Brienne being brought back to life herself as an undead (I know how crackpotty this one is but wouldn’t it be cool 😉).

Anyways, I just think there’s too much that can be done with Stoneheart for her to die so simply at the hands of Arya so she may have some closure with her mother. If you ask me, Jon could do with a “talk” with Catelyn as well. In fact, all the remaining Stark children could.

Now, I’m not saying that it’s impossible that Arya will kill her mom in the Riverlands, I just don’t think it’s the most plausible outcome. Either way, we’ll just have to wait till TWOW is released to see how it all plays out. Whenever they comes out lol…😏

Let me know your thoughts. And if you have evidences to disprove me, I’ll gladly hear them out, provided you’re polite and respectful when explaining them. 🙂

blog.name: godihatethisfreakingcat
blog.title: A Flesh-Monger, A Fool, and a Coward
blog.description:
Medical student in my 20s, fan of many things (primarily Tolkien and cute animal photos), known as seashadows on AO3 and Livejournal. I do not, in fact, hate this freaking cat.

Links can be found under the 'navigate' tab.

tags: a song of ice and fire
I was an Arya-esque semi-outcast for my autism with Sansa's sensibilities on things like getting dirty when I was a kid
I was bookish and loved making up stories with my dolls
but also liked to play outside and do pretend with my brothers
the sisters both have quirks that I love
like it's so adorable that Sansa says 'tummy'
and Arya holds grudges which is kind of cute in a 10-year-old
summary: Sign me up for the “I love both Sansa and Arya Stark, they’ve suffered too much, and I hope they develop a good relationship...
body:
Sign me up for the “I love both Sansa and Arya Stark, they’ve suffered too much, and I hope they develop a good relationship when they’re older and more mature (also please let them survive)” Club.

As long as there are cookies.

blog.name: danyllura
blog.title: Bein' Classy & Shit
blog.description:
Fuck me gently with a chainsaw, do I look like mother Theresa?

Trish|she/her|17|queer

summary:
Sansa: Look, lets just agree to say I’m sorry on a count of three.
Sansa: one...two...three
Arya: 
Sansa:
Sansa: Now I’m just...
body:
Sansa: Look, lets just agree to say I’m sorry on a count of three.

Sansa: one…two…three

Arya:

Sansa:

Sansa: Now I’m just disappointed in the both of us.
